Posts.Content: Hi I finished radiotherapy in April (have had chemo, surgery and radiotherapy) am having Herceptin injections last one end of September (18 in total).  I have sporadic sharp  pains in my breast where the cancer was and my breast is swollen.  I saw my oncologist a couple of weeks ago and she said that it Is all the treatment I have had , also I do have lymphedema of the breast which can swell the breast.  I don't think the hot weather helps either!!  Sarah
Posts.Title: After treatment

Posts.Content: Hi PixieandtheDragon Thank you for your reply it is reassuring to know.  Next time I will be more aware and ask what medication I can take for the pain - I was just taking paracetemol but will ask about the ibuprofen as well - thank you. Just had an ice lolly and yes it does indeed work!!! So will keep up with those.  I hope your treatment is going well also will keep posted xx
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: Glad I am not the only one re skin.  Yes definitely the right decision re work. How hold are your boys?  I have one son who is 19 but currently at University. Re the trots - indeed just come off of the toilet yet again!!!!!!  but as you say manageable. I hope you can get lots of rest in between looking after you boys X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Happygolucky280 I will ask my ONC next time I see her about the gabapentin.  It may be the P element of the treatment causing the stingy mouth.  How many treatments have you had?  My second lot will be in two weeks X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: My next dose is on the 24th October.  Feeling much better today but did try and go to work yesterday which was a no no!  Lasted four hours but then had to come home and was exhausted so I have decided to take some time off of work to have my treatment and have recovery time and not worrying about going into work.  I have come out in a rash all across my chest and neck but went to the hospital and they said it happens and to take puriton which is helping.  It is not so bad today. I know what you  mean about the taste buds all I want to eat at the moment is soup followed by an ice lolly.  That is how I feel weak and off but after a rest or a lie down the weakness seems to go for you to be able to do something else. Hope everyone is doing okay - X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: I am self administering the injection filgratzim for the first seven days after my chemo.  Is this the same as you?  My stingy throat and mouth started on the third day after my chemo but has now calmed down I am on my sixth day after chemo.   I have eaten ice lollies that does help.  X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: There will definitely be a plan B - keep us posted xx
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: Hi sarahmuggles here Started TCHP on 5 October 2017 took two days in hospital but got there in the end!!! Had a reaction to the drug that starts with a D! but other than that things seemed to be fine.  After two days though very achy bones did anyone else get this?  This is now the 4 day and it seems to be subsiding but now my mouth is starting to sting!  Reading all your messages makes me realise I am not on my own.  Cannot seem to sleep at all anyone any tips !!  Feel tired but just wont go off to sleep.  Reading all your messages has helped so much - thank you.
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: Hi I had my second session of TCHP yesterday (25 October 2017) the first cycle I had a reaction to docetaxol but they got it under control with meds. Yesterday they started my meds before having docetaxol but even after that I had another bad reaction - rash, hot and breathing problems.  They stopped the docetaxol then and said that my ONC will review treatment.  has anyone had this as I am worried that I wont be having docetaxol again and after first cycle ONC was very very pleased with the outcome and reduction of tumour. Thanks in advance XXXX
Posts.Title: Stopping Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your messages - just a bit disconcerting when it happens - onwards and upwards! XXX
Posts.Title: Stopping Docetaxel
